question_text: Four identical particles of equal masses 1 kg made to move along the circumference of a circle of radius 1 m under the action of their own mutual gravitational attraction. The speed of each particle will be:

Two stars of masses m and 2m at a distance d rotate about their common centre of mass in free space. The period of revolution is:
The hysteresis curve for a material is shown in the figure. The retentivity and coercivity are respectively:

Consider two satellites S1 and S2 with periods of revolution 1 hr and 8 hr respectively revolving around a planet in circular orbits. The ratio of angular velocity of S1 to the angular velocity of S2 is:

A solid sphere of radius r made of a soft material of bulk modulus K is surrounded by a liquid in a cylindrical container. A massless piston of area 'a' floats on the surface of the liquid, covering entire cross section of cylindrical container. When a mass m is placed on the surface of the piston to compress the liquid, the fractional decrement in the radius of the sphere (dr/r) is:

In a Young's double slit experiment, if the source is moved by a distance x perpendicular to the central axis, the central maximum shifts by:

If speed V, area A and force F are chosen as fundamental units, then the dimension of Young's modulus will be:

Assuming the sun to be a spherical body of radius R at a temperature of T K, evaluate the total radiant power, incident on Earth, at a distance r from the Sun. (Earth radius = r0).
A cylindrical wire of radius R carries a uniform current density J. The magnetic field at a distance r (r < R) from the axis is:

Match List-I with List-II. List I: (a) Source of microwave frequency (b) Source of infrared frequency (c) Source of Gamma Rays (d) Source of X-rays. List II: (i) Radioactive decay (ii) Magnetron (iii) Inner shell electrons (iv) Vibration of atoms/molecules.

The work done by a gas molecule in an isolated system during expansion is:
An alpha particle and a proton are accelerated from rest by the same potential difference V. Calculate the ratio of linear momenta acquired: p_alpha / p_proton.
Which Zener diode circuit is correctly biased for voltage regulation?
If the time period of a simple pendulum is T = 2π √(l/g), the percentage error in g, given l is 10cm ± 1mm and T is 0.5s for 100 oscillations measured with a watch of 1s resolution, is:

Two small spheres each of mass 10 mg are suspended from a point by threads 0.5 m long. They are equally charged and repel each other to a distance of 0.2 m. The charge on each sphere is (g = 10 m/s²):
A heat engine has an efficiency of 1/6. When the temperature of the sink is reduced by 62°C, its efficiency doubles. The temperature of the source is:
A sphere of radius R is kept on a rough horizontal surface. A horizontal force F is applied at a height h from the center. For pure rolling, h must be:
A monoatomic gas is heated at constant pressure. The percentage of heat supplied that increases the internal energy of the gas is:
A plane electromagnetic wave of frequency 25 MHz travels in free space along the x-direction. At a particular point in space and time, E = 6.3 j V/m. What is B at this point?
A body of mass 2 kg moves under the influence of a force F = (3t i + 5t j) N. If it starts from rest at t=0, the velocity at t=5 s is:
Find the peak current in a circuit containing a 220 V, 50 Hz AC source connected to a resistor of 110 Ω.
The fundamental frequency of a closed organ pipe of length 20 cm is equal to the second overtone of an organ pipe open at both ends. The length of the open organ pipe is:
The de Broglie wavelength of a proton and alpha particle are equal. The ratio of their velocities is:

Two capacitors of capacitances C and 2C are charged to potential differences V and 2V respectively. If they are connected in parallel with like plates connected together, the final common potential is:

The correct order of ionic radii of the species N³⁻, O²⁻, F⁻, Na⁺, Mg²⁺, Al³⁺ is:

options.Option 1: Al³⁺ < Mg²⁺ < Na⁺ < F⁻ < O²⁻ < N³⁻
options.Option 2: N³⁻ < O²⁻ < F⁻ < Na⁺ < Mg²⁺ < Al³⁺
options.Option 3: Al³⁺ < Na⁺ < Mg²⁺ < F⁻ < O²⁻ < N³⁻
options.Option 4: N³⁻ > F⁻ > O²⁻ > Na⁺ > Mg²⁺ > Al³⁺
